pull_request.title: Use f-strings for plural forms and other interpolation
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Some strings are composed in a way that may pose problems for translation:
- strings formed using `format` with multiple (unlabeled) `{}`
- or with a single `{}` because translation may not require (or easily accommodate) the value inserted by `{}`.
- strings formed by concatenation of partial messages
- plurals were formed by adding an -s.

##### Description of changes

- Replace problematic `str.format`'s with f-strings
- Add a better function for plural forms, and use it

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests

commits.message: Distance Matrix: Choose string variable with most distinct values as default label

Merge pull request #6233 from janezd/distance-matrix-default-label

Distance Matrix: String variable with most distinct values as default label

issue.title: by default display labels in the distance matrix
issue.body:
**What's your use case?**

By default, Distance Matrix enumerates columns and rows. If labels are provided, one would expect that that would be the default setting. Now that the hierarchical clustering is changed similarly, we could make the Distance Matrix behave like this as well.

**What's your proposed solution?**
When the input data contains a label (a single string-typed meta feature), Distance Matrix should display these labels for default. Perhaps copy the solution from the new version of Hierarchical Clustering.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/726604/204520909-9c2bc4e8-fdb9-44c8-9f7a-aa7239645c0f.png)

commits.message: Feature Statistics: Use deferred commit
Orange.statistics.util.nanmode: use legacy behaviour for keepdims
Feature Statistics: Compute mode of numeric variables

Merge pull request #6174 from janezd/feature-statistics-commit

Feature statistics: Use deferred commit + minor warning fix

pull_request.title: [FIX] Feature statistics: Use deferred commit + minor warning fix
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Fixes partially #6173 (everything except documentation).

##### Description of changes

1. Statistics is now committed after receiving data -- as it should be, unconditionally. A test that the widget does not send this data when auto commit is off is removed (because it's wrong).

    Reduced data is committed after receiving data (unconditionally) and when selection is changed (conditionally).

2. Mode is also computed for numeric variables. Output needs discussion, though. See https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/6173#issuecomment-1279185345.

3. Fixed warnings. 

    - a warning from scipy.stats.mode is fixed by setting `keepdims=True`. `False` also passes tests but I'd keep the behaviour to be safe.
    - `scipy.stats.stats` is deprecated, `scipy.stats` should be used instead. Hence we now call `scipy.stats.mode`. `ModeResult` is not exported from `scipy.stats.stats` to `scipy.stats`, so I used `type(res)` instead.

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests
- [ ] Documentation

issue.title: Feature Statistics - open issues

labels.name: needs discussion
labels.description: Core developers need to discuss the issue

issue.body:
<!--
If something's not right with Orange, fill out the bug report template at:
https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/new?assignees=&labels=bug+report&template=bug_report.md&title=

If you have an idea for a new feature, fill out the feature request template at:
https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/new?assignees=&labels=&template=feature_request.md&title=
-->
After PR #6158 there are some open issues left that should be discussed:
- [ ] Compute Mode for numeric variables?
- [ ] Show Mode in the widget to make it consistent with the new (and improved) output? Currently the mode is squeezed into the Median column, which would otherwise be empty for categorical variables. But numeric variables could have both...
- [ ] Documentation should be updated
- [ ] There are some warnings which could cause issues in the future:
```
Orange/statistics/util.py:510: FutureWarning: Unlike other reduction functions (e.g. `skew`, `kurtosis`), the default behavior of `mode` typically preserves the axis it acts along. In SciPy 1.11.0, this behavior will change: the default value of `keepdims` will become False, the `axis` over which the statistic is taken will be eliminated, and the value None will no longer be accepted. Set `keepdims` to True or False to avoid this warning.
  res = scipy.stats.stats.mode(x, axis)
```
```
orange-widget-base/orangewidget/gui.py:2068: UserWarning: decorate OWFeatureStatistics.commit with @gui.deferred and then explicitly call commit.now or commit.deferred.
```

commits.message: Feature Statistics: Adapt output to types of variables

Merge pull request #6158 from janezd/feature-statistics-for-categorical

Feature Statistics: Adapt output to types of variables

issue.title: "Statistics" output of Feature statistics is inconsistent
issue.body: **What's wrong?** For categorical variables, Feature Statistics determines the Mode as the central tendency and puts it in the Median column. That's OK with me, although it could be described a bit better in the help popup. A separate Mode column would even be better. But if I want to put the feature statistics in a table (or save them in a file) the categories in the Median column are converted to integers. This is inconsistent, and unclear because the mapping from a category to the corresponding number isn't obvious. **How can we reproduce the problem?** See attached zip file and screenshot **What's your environment?** - Operating system: Mac OS 12.6 on Silicon - Orange version: 3.32.0 - How you installed Orange: from DMG [Feature statistics inconsistent output.ows.zip](https://github.com/biolab/orange3/files/9674384/Feature.statistics.inconsistent.output.ows.zip)

pull_request.title: Feature Statistics: Adapt output to types of variables
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Fixes #6151.

##### Description of changes

- The most common value for discrete variables is now shown in separate column of output. All columns that don't apply (including min and max) are set to undefined.
- Output columns adapt to types of variables: if there are no categorical variables, the majority column is removed. If there are only categorical, the columns that do not apply are removed.

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests

review.body:
This works and can be merged after the table name fix.
Some additional considerations:
- We might want to call the new column Mode instead of Majority

commits.message: Check box with disabled state: Block signals

Merge pull request #213 from janezd/cb-with-disable-state-signals

[FIX] Check box with disabled state: Block signals

pull_request.title: [FIX] Check box with disabled state: Block signals
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Consider the following code:

```python
        cb = gui.checkBox(
            None, self, "label_only_subset", "Show labels only for subset",
            disabled=True,
            callback=self._update_labels, stateWhenDisabled=False)
```

Suppose that `label_only_subset` is initially `True`. This will add the check box, connect the corresponding signals and, at the very end, call the checkbox's `setDisabled(True)`. This will result in a call of method `_updateChecked`, which will  call `setCheckState(False)`. Because the checkbox was initially `True`, this therefore triggers the specified callback, that is, the widget's method `_update_labels`. This fails because the widget is not fully initialized yet.

The solution proposed in this PR, blocking signals, will block all signals caused by changing the state of the checkbox. The assumption here is that the check box is disabled because the widget state (for instance, the type of data it has) is such that checking/unchecking the check box is in fact not an option: the widget essentially disregards the check box. *However*, badly(?) written widget may assume that the check box has set the attributes (in this case: `label_only_subset`) to the reasonable value and that the widget will be notified about this.

I don't know if there are indeed such widgets. If there are, the change proposed in this PR will break them.

The only alternative I see is that `gui.checkbox` would have a flag that is set only when the initialization is finished, and it would block the signals until then. Which is ugly.

##### Description of changes


##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [ ] Tests
- [ ] Documentation

pull_request.title: Use f-strings for plural forms and other interpolation
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Some strings are composed in a way that may pose problems for translation:
- strings formed using `format` with multiple (unlabeled) `{}`
- or with a single `{}` because translation may not require (or easily accommodate) the value inserted by `{}`.
- strings formed by concatenation of partial messages
- plurals were formed by adding an -s.

##### Description of changes

- Replace problematic `str.format`'s with f-strings
- Add a better function for plural forms, and use it

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests

issue.body:
**What's your use case?**

By default, Distance Matrix enumerates columns and rows. If labels are provided, one would expect that that would be the default setting. Now that the hierarchical clustering is changed similarly, we could make the Distance Matrix behave like this as well.

**What's your proposed solution?**
When the input data contains a label (a single string-typed meta feature), Distance Matrix should display these labels for default. Perhaps copy the solution from the new version of Hierarchical Clustering.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/726604/204520909-9c2bc4e8-fdb9-44c8-9f7a-aa7239645c0f.png)

pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Some strings are composed in a way that may pose problems for translation:
- strings formed using `format` with multiple (unlabeled) `{}`
- or with a single `{}` because translation may not require (or easily accommodate) the value inserted by `{}`.
- strings formed by concatenation of partial messages
- plurals were formed by adding an -s.

##### Description of changes

- Replace problematic `str.format`'s with f-strings
- Add a better function for plural forms, and use it

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes

pull_request.title: [FIX] Feature statistics: Use deferred commit + minor warning fix
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Fixes partially #6173 (everything except documentation).

##### Description of changes

1. Statistics is now committed after receiving data -- as it should be, unconditionally. A test that the widget does not send this data when auto commit is off is removed (because it's wrong).

    Reduced data is committed after receiving data (unconditionally) and when selection is changed (conditionally).

2. Mode is also computed for numeric variables. Output needs discussion, though. See https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/6173#issuecomment-1279185345.

3. Fixed warnings. 

    - a warning from scipy.stats.mode is fixed by setting `keepdims=True`. `False` also passes tests but I'd keep the behaviour to be safe.
    - `scipy.stats.stats` is deprecated, `scipy.stats` should be used instead. Hence we now call `scipy.stats.mode`. `ModeResult` is not exported from `scipy.stats.stats` to `scipy.stats`, so I used `type(res)` instead.

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests
- [ ] Documentation

issue.title: Feature Statistics - open issues

labels.name: needs discussion
labels.description: Core developers need to discuss the issue

issue.body:
<!--
If something's not right with Orange, fill out the bug report template at:
https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/new?assignees=&labels=bug+report&template=bug_report.md&title=

If you have an idea for a new feature, fill out the feature request template at:
https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/new?assignees=&labels=&template=feature_request.md&title=
-->
After PR #6158 there are some open issues left that should be discussed:
- [ ] Compute Mode for numeric variables?
- [ ] Show Mode in the widget to make it consistent with the new (and improved) output? Currently the mode is squeezed into the Median column, which would otherwise be empty for categorical variables. But numeric variables could have both...
- [ ] Documentation should be updated
- [ ] There are some warnings which could cause issues in the future:
```
Orange/statistics/util.py:510: FutureWarning: Unlike other reduction functions (e.g. `skew`, `kurtosis`), the default behavior of `mode` typically preserves the axis it acts along. In SciPy 1.11.0, this behavior will change: the default value of `keepdims` will become False, the `axis` over which the statistic is taken will be eliminated, and the value None will no longer be accepted. Set `keepdims` to True or False to avoid this warning.
  res = scipy.stats.stats.mode(x, axis)
```
```
orange-widget-base/orangewidget/gui.py:2068: UserWarning: decorate OWFeatureStatistics.commit with @gui.deferred and then explicitly call commit.now or commit.deferred.
```

issue.title: "Statistics" output of Feature statistics is inconsistent
issue.body: **What's wrong?** For categorical variables, Feature Statistics determines the Mode as the central tendency and puts it in the Median column. That's OK with me, although it could be described a bit better in the help popup. A separate Mode column would even be better. But if I want to put the feature statistics in a table (or save them in a file) the categories in the Median column are converted to integers. This is inconsistent, and unclear because the mapping from a category to the corresponding number isn't obvious. **How can we reproduce the problem?** See attached zip file and screenshot **What's your environment?** - Operating system: Mac OS 12.6 on Silicon - Orange version: 3.32.0 - How you installed Orange: from DMG [Feature statistics inconsistent output.ows.zip](https://github.com/biolab/orange3/files/9674384/Feature.statistics.inconsistent.output.ows.zip)

This works and can be merged after the table name fix.

commits.message: Check box with disabled state: Block signals

Merge pull request #213 from janezd/cb-with-disable-state-signals

[FIX] Check box with disabled state: Block signals

pull_request.title: [FIX] Check box with disabled state: Block signals
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Consider the following code:

```python
        cb = gui.checkBox(
            None, self, "label_only_subset", "Show labels only for subset",
            disabled=True,
            callback=self._update_labels, stateWhenDisabled=False)
```

Suppose that `label_only_subset` is initially `True`. This will add the check box, connect the corresponding signals and, at the very end, call the checkbox's `setDisabled(True)`. This will result in a call of method `_updateChecked`, which will  call `setCheckState(False)`. Because the checkbox was initially `True`, this therefore triggers the specified callback, that is, the widget's method `_update_labels`. This fails because the widget is not fully initialized yet.

The solution proposed in this PR, blocking signals, will block all signals caused by changing the state of the checkbox. The assumption here is that the check box is disabled because the widget state (for instance, the type of data it has) is such that checking/unchecking the check box is in fact not an option: the widget essentially disregards the check box. *However*, badly(?) written widget may assume that the check box has set the attributes (in this case: `label_only_subset`) to the reasonable value and that the widget will be notified about this.

I don't know if there are indeed such widgets. If there are, the change proposed in this PR will break them.

The only alternative I see is that `gui.checkbox` would have a flag that is set only when the initialization is finished, and it would block the signals until then. Which is ugly.

##### Description of changes


##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [ ] Tests
- [ ] Documentation

pull_request.title: Use f-strings for plural forms and other interpolation
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Some strings are composed in a way that may pose problems for translation:
- strings formed using `format` with multiple (unlabeled) `{}`
- or with a single `{}` because translation may not require (or easily accommodate) the value inserted by `{}`.
- strings formed by concatenation of partial messages
- plurals were formed by adding an -s.

##### Description of changes

- Replace problematic `str.format`'s with f-strings
- Add a better function for plural forms, and use it

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests

commits.message: Distance Matrix: Choose string variable with most distinct values as default label

Merge pull request #6233 from janezd/distance-matrix-default-label

Distance Matrix: String variable with most distinct values as default label

issue.title: by default display labels in the distance matrix
issue.body:
**What's your use case?**

By default, Distance Matrix enumerates columns and rows. If labels are provided, one would expect that that would be the default setting. Now that the hierarchical clustering is changed similarly, we could make the Distance Matrix behave like this as well.

**What's your proposed solution?**
When the input data contains a label (a single string-typed meta feature), Distance Matrix should display these labels for default. Perhaps copy the solution from the new version of Hierarchical Clustering.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/726604/204520909-9c2bc4e8-fdb9-44c8-9f7a-aa7239645c0f.png)

- or with a single `{}` because translation may not require (or easily accommodate) the value inserted by `{}`.
- strings formed by concatenation of partial messages
- plurals were formed by adding an -s.

##### Description of changes

- Replace problematic `str.format`'s with f-strings
- Add a better function for plural forms, and use it

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests

pull_request.title: [FIX] Feature statistics: Use deferred commit + minor warning fix
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Fixes partially #6173 (everything except documentation).

##### Description of changes

1. Statistics is now committed after receiving data -- as it should be, unconditionally. A test that the widget does not send this data when auto commit is off is removed (because it's wrong).

    Reduced data is committed after receiving data (unconditionally) and when selection is changed (conditionally).

2. Mode is also computed for numeric variables. Output needs discussion, though. See https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/6173#issuecomment-1279185345.

3. Fixed warnings. 

    - a warning from scipy.stats.mode is fixed by setting `keepdims=True`. `False` also passes tests but I'd keep the behaviour to be safe.
    - `scipy.stats.stats` is deprecated, `scipy.stats` should be used instead. Hence we now call `scipy.stats.mode`. `ModeResult` is not exported from `scipy.stats.stats` to `scipy.stats`, so I used `type(res)` instead.

##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [X] Tests
- [ ] Documentation

issue.title: Feature Statistics - open issues

labels.name: needs discussion
labels.description: Core developers need to discuss the issue

issue.body:
<!--
If something's not right with Orange, fill out the bug report template at:
https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/new?assignees=&labels=bug+report&template=bug_report.md&title=

If you have an idea for a new feature, fill out the feature request template at:
https://github.com/biolab/orange3/issues/new?assignees=&labels=&template=feature_request.md&title=
-->
After PR #6158 there are some open issues left that should be discussed:
- [ ] Compute Mode for numeric variables?
- [ ] Show Mode in the widget to make it consistent with the new (and improved) output? Currently the mode is squeezed into the Median column, which would otherwise be empty for categorical variables. But numeric variables could have both...
- [ ] Documentation should be updated
- [ ] There are some warnings which could cause issues in the future:
```
Orange/statistics/util.py:510: FutureWarning: Unlike other reduction functions (e.g. `skew`, `kurtosis`), the default behavior of `mode` typically preserves the axis it acts along. In SciPy 1.11.0, this behavior will change: the default value of `keepdims` will become False, the `axis` over which the statistic is taken will be eliminated, and the value None will no longer be accepted. Set `keepdims` to True or False to avoid this warning.
  res = scipy.stats.stats.mode(x, axis)
```
```
orange-widget-base/orangewidget/gui.py:2068: UserWarning: decorate OWFeatureStatistics.commit with @gui.deferred and then explicitly call commit.now or commit.deferred.
```

issue.title: "Statistics" output of Feature statistics is inconsistent
issue.body: **What's wrong?** For categorical variables, Feature Statistics determines the Mode as the central tendency and puts it in the Median column. That's OK with me, although it could be described a bit better in the help popup. A separate Mode column would even be better. But if I want to put the feature statistics in a table (or save them in a file) the categories in the Median column are converted to integers. This is inconsistent, and unclear because the mapping from a category to the corresponding number isn't obvious. **How can we reproduce the problem?** See attached zip file and screenshot **What's your environment?** - Operating system: Mac OS 12.6 on Silicon - Orange version: 3.32.0 - How you installed Orange: from DMG [Feature statistics inconsistent output.ows.zip](https://github.com/biolab/orange3/files/9674384/Feature.statistics.inconsistent.output.ows.zip)

It's better to:
1) put an f before this string
2) leave this line in `OWFeatureStatistics.commit`, where self.data.name actually exists

:bug: :bug: :bug: 
If you move it outside of this function, don't forget that this can return None in which case you should not set the name...

review.body:
This works and can be merged after the table name fix.
Some additional considerations:
- We might want to call the new column Mode instead of Majority
- After this change the widget contents and the output table will no longer be in sync. To make it more consistent, I would vote to use Mode in the widget as well - would make even more sense if that column is used for all variables (C and N).
-  Although not related to this change, I noticed these in the log:
  `UserWarning: decorate OWFeatureStatistics.commit with @gui.deferred and then explicitly call commit.now or commit.deferred`

commits.message: Check box with disabled state: Block signals

Merge pull request #213 from janezd/cb-with-disable-state-signals

[FIX] Check box with disabled state: Block signals

pull_request.title: [FIX] Check box with disabled state: Block signals
pull_request.body:
##### Issue

Consider the following code:

```python
        cb = gui.checkBox(
            None, self, "label_only_subset", "Show labels only for subset",
            disabled=True,
            callback=self._update_labels, stateWhenDisabled=False)
```

Suppose that `label_only_subset` is initially `True`. This will add the check box, connect the corresponding signals and, at the very end, call the checkbox's `setDisabled(True)`. This will result in a call of method `_updateChecked`, which will  call `setCheckState(False)`. Because the checkbox was initially `True`, this therefore triggers the specified callback, that is, the widget's method `_update_labels`. This fails because the widget is not fully initialized yet.

The solution proposed in this PR, blocking signals, will block all signals caused by changing the state of the checkbox. The assumption here is that the check box is disabled because the widget state (for instance, the type of data it has) is such that checking/unchecking the check box is in fact not an option: the widget essentially disregards the check box. *However*, badly(?) written widget may assume that the check box has set the attributes (in this case: `label_only_subset`) to the reasonable value and that the widget will be notified about this.

I don't know if there are indeed such widgets. If there are, the change proposed in this PR will break them.

The only alternative I see is that `gui.checkbox` would have a flag that is set only when the initialization is finished, and it would block the signals until then. Which is ugly.

##### Description of changes


##### Includes
- [X] Code changes
- [ ] Tests
- [ ] Documentation
